headline: Why Micron is investing another $30B in US manufacturing, R&D
summary: Micron (MU) will be investing $30 billion in the US, totaling $200 billion in manufacturing and research and development. The investment is intended to allow Micron to expand its manufacturing capabilities within the US. Yahoo Finance Technology Editor Dan Howley joins Market Domination with Josh Lipton to discuss the details. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Micron Technology to Spend $200B to Boost Domestic Chip Production

headline: Micron boosts planned U.S. investment by $30 billion amid AI-driven demand
summary: Investing.com -- Micron Technology Inc (NASDAQ:MU) has announced plans to expand its U.S.-based semiconductor manufacturing and research footprint with an investment totaling approximately $200 billion. The move, in partnership with the Trump administration, includes $150 billion earmarked for manufacturing and $50 billion for research and development, and will create an estimated 90,000 direct and indirect jobs.

raw.headline: Micron boosts planned U.S. investment by $30 billion amid AI-driven demand

The move, in partnership with the Trump administration, includes $150 billion earmarked for manufacturing and $50 billion for research and development, and will create an estimated 90,000 direct and indirect jobs.

headline: Micron to Invest About $200 Billion in US Chip Manufacturing
summary: Micron Technology said it will spend about $200 billion on US manufacturing, research and development. The spending will include roughly $150 billion for domestic manufacturing capacity and another $50 billion for R&D. Jake Silverman has more on "Bloomberg The Open."

headline: Micron investments, Chime IPO, GameStop: Trending Tickers
summary: Micron Technology (MU) has set its sights on expanding its investments into the US, now planning to invest $200 billion into domestic semiconductor manufacturing and research and development (R&D). Online banking service Chime Financial (CHYM) is set to make its public debut on the Nasdaq on Thursday, pricing its IPO at $27 per share. GameStop (GME) stock is sinking after announcing plans to raise $1.75 billion in a convertible bond sale. This comes as the video game retailer leans heavier into the crypto space and has purchased over $500 million in bitcoin (BTC-USD) so far. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Micron expands US manufacturing commitment to $200B
summary: The increased investment, which includes another $30 billion in expanded production and a second Idaho fab, comes as the Trump administration finalizes $275 million in CHIPS funding for the company.

raw.headline: Micron expands US manufacturing commitment to $200B

headline: Micron expands US investments to $200 billion amid Trump's onshoring push
summary: This marks an additional investment of $30 billion, beyond prior plans, Micron said, sending its shares down about 1% in premarket trading.  Micron now joins a litany of U.S. tech firms and chipmakers who have announced hundreds of billions of dollars in domestic investments against the backdrop of Trump's efforts to produce more semiconductors on American soil.
